description: Using a shapefile, Nitin Paighowal visualizes the Coffee Bean Belt, in which are located the top coffee producing nations.
title: World Coffee Production
instructions: Producing countries are indicated by a hot cup. Color represents the type of coffee produced. Hover over cups for details about each country's production.

description: This viz looks at historical data for snowfall levels in the German state of Hesse. It was created for a data-journalism piece by a group of journalism students at University of Applied Sciences Darmstadt - click the link above to read the article (in German).
title: Snow over the holidays
instructions: Click on a weather station in the map to see the corresponding line chart in the right-hand side panel.

description: Ivett Kovács is ready for 2018 with this sunburst calendar viz.
title: 2018 Calendar
instructions: Hover over the chart to find out if it is a #MakeoverMonday

description: Pablo Saenz de Tejada analyzes voting data to tell the story of a divided Catalonia.
title: Division in Catalonia
instructions: Hover for more details. Click to highlight.

description: Ever looked at the Miss Universe pageant as a source of data? Mikhaila Frankenfield did, and she discovered some interesting trends across the 70 year history of this competition.
title: Gallery of Queens - Miss Universe Dashboard
instructions: Use the slider to narrow down the focus to a subset of years. Hover over the marks in the line, bar, and pie charts to learn more about the contestants across the years.

description: One of three winners of the student viz contest, Ankit Borkhataria creates dashboards visualizing traffic data in Montgomery County, Maryland.
title: Traffic Violations in Maryland
instructions: Click on the tabs in the top-left to see full analysis.

description: Harpreet Ghuman's viz dives deeper into Washington DC’s “big four” sports team and (lack of) advancement to a conference title since 1998.
title: Washington DC's Big Four Sports Teams
instructions: Hover over charts to highlight and see more detail.

description: Charis Klimas compares real and fake Christmas tree sales as part of #MakeoverMonday
title: Christmas Tree Sales
instructions: Hover over charts for more information.

description: Rodrigo Calloni summarizes a year of #MakeoverMonday in the most festive way possible!
title: A Year of Makeover Mondays
instructions: On the left side of the screen, pick a mark color to highlight the vizzes on the tree. Click the balls on the tree to send a holiday tweet to the author (you must have a Twitter account to use this). Click on the marks on the right side of the page to open the viz in the browser.

description: Still have holiday packages on the way? Sidney Sullivan delivers! Find out if your state is one of the places package thieves lurk.
title: Package Theft across America
instructions: Hover over the map to see how the US states rank in terms of package theft. In the charts to the right, hover over the marks to see how consumers think changes can be made.

description: Data Notes shows Britons' favorite items in famous chocolate assortments according to a recent YouGov survey.
title: Best Christmas Chocolates
instructions: Orange shows the favorite chocolate, light grey bars are #2 and #3 while dark grey bars indicate least favorite. Access the original YouGov survey thanks to the link provided.

description: Katie Smith looks at the history of the New York Times best seller list.
title: The New York Times Best Seller List
instructions: Click through the tabs at the top of the viz.

description: Explore 2017 Christmas Music Streaming trends by country. See when a country starts 'seriously' streaming Christmas music and see their top 10 songs.
title: 2017 Christmas Streaming Trends
instructions: Hover over charts for more information, and click to filter. Click on a song in the bar chart to play it.

description: Check out Sherry Shen's comparison of video game consoles based on global sales, user ratings, number of games released and many other aspects.
title: The Video Game Console War
instructions: Hover over charts for more details.

description: Beth Somerfield teaches us everything we might want to know about all the beer styles in the world. See how many of these you can find in your area!
title: An Exploration of Beer
instructions: In the beer styles section, use the search boxes to highlight specific styles. In the section below, use the sliders to narrow down types of beer based on bitterness, booziness, and color. Learn more about each style by selecting a style and reading about the beer. Finally, use the filters at the bottom of the viz to find beers in your state.

description: Amit Naik analyzes Indian PM Narendra Modi's tweeting pattern in this story points viz.
title: Narendra Modi on Twitter
instructions: Navigate through the story using story points tabs at the top. Follow author's instructions when interacting with charts.

description: The UN Action Campaign for the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) shows the results of the ongoing MYWorld 2030 survey.
title: MYWorld 2030
instructions: The longer the bars the more people find the particular SDG of importance. The indicator in the middle shows the perceived change over time. Use the filters to see how people from a particular country or region are viewing the goals.

description: Did you know Green Eggs and Ham was written with only 50 different words? Find out the most common words and phrases from the children's book in this viz by Corey Jones.
title: Dr. Seuss Green Eggs and Ham
instructions: Select a phrase to highlight in green.

description: Learn about the wolf population in Italy with this viz by Filippo Mastroianni.
title: Italian Wolf
instructions: Click on a region to filter. Use navigation at the top to switch views.

title: Equal Pay for Equal Work - Women's Wages in the United States
instructions: Use the pages at the top to navigate through the different charts. Hover over marks to expose the tool tips with more detail. On the final page, use the arrows to step through a timeline to equity.
